channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Fed’s Job Market Forecast Turned Stale in One Week
item.description: The unemployment rate surpassed the Fed’s peak estimate for the year.

item.title: Factory 2030 runs on more than code. As a CEO, I see the power of agentic AI—and the trust gap that we must close
item.description: Autonomous systems often make headlines. But on the factory floor, the real goal is reliability. And that means keeping humans involved.

item.title: ‘Robots are going to be amongst us’: Qualcomm exec says buckle up for the next 5 years. Your car is going to be the first shoe to drop
item.description: Driver-assisted technology demand is growing for AI features like hands-free highway assist.

item.title: The Safest Type of Traffic Intersection Is Very Controversial
item.description: These intersections are perfect for suburban streets, where intersections are spaced far apart and roads designed for high speeds.

item.title: Neuroscience Says You Need a ‘Personal Curriculum’ for 2026
item.description: Neuroscientists and productivity experts both endorse the recent TikTok trend of setting yourself a ‘personal curriculum.’

item.title: Quantum computing could be a $198 billion industry in the next 15 years, Jefferies analyst says
item.description: The downside is that the physics and engineering needed to make them work has only just moved out of the theoretical realm and into reality.

item.title: Prices at the gas pump are the lowest since the pandemic and still falling—just in time for record-high holiday travel
item.description: Fuel and crude prices near five-year lows as global oil output led by OPEC and the U.S. continues to rise.
